Posts.Content: Hi chloecat45 When I started on Letrozole the brand was Accord which I found to be ok, then about 6 months later I noticed the brand was Manx which I couldn't get on with.  I got my GP to make sure I went back to Accord. That suited me for many months but gradually succumbed to more side effects than before.  My consultant gave me the choice of changing to Tamoxifon or Anastrozole, so I opted for Anastrozole on a trial period.  I'll persevere with fingers crossed.
Posts.Title: Letrozole to anastrole

Posts.Content: I have been taking Letrozole since my lumpectomy in July,,2017 .   At first I had no trouble, but for the last 6 months I have had so many side effects it's making me feel miserable,  more painful joints, tiredness, memory loss and a few more.  My consultant suggest a change from Letrozole to Anastrozole which may not have as many side effects. Has anyone on Anastrozole had any trouble since taking them?
Posts.Title: Letrozole to anastrole

Posts.Content: Hello T10 I had my lumpectomy nearly 2 years ago.  Like you I tried all different bras, but have discovered a good range of crop style bras from Sainsburys . No wires,  no padding, no hooks.  They are soft but at the sametime gently supportive..  I still wear an ordinary bra if I go out but I still wear the crop bra around the house and find them very comfortable for sleeping in.  I hope you find a solution.
Posts.Title: Bras!!!

Posts.Content: Good morning Susie.  Like you, I was diagnosed with stage 1, nearly 2 years ago.  It came as a shock because i never felt  the lump neither my GP but went for my 3 year mammogram, and bingo!  I had 15 sessions of radiotherapy and put on Letrozole because i had gone through the menopause.  Once you get over the shock, everything will take it's course and you will gradually start to feel better .I'm not saying it's  plain sailing because everyone is different, but you will soon  come to terms with it.  I came to the decision that it wasnt going to hinder my everyday life.  Be strong . All the best X
Posts.Title: Stage one breast cancer.

Posts.Content: Thank Leolady56 for your warm welcome.  Have seen my GP  about different things, and some of the problems are being put down to my age!  I'm  77 but sometimes i feel 107.   I shall carry on regardless..thanks again
Posts.Title: memory and speech

Posts.Content: Afternoon Ginacaria,  it's nice to know that we aren't the only ones bothered by these tablets,  its a pity we're not connected by something nice instead..  we can battle on together and see the light at the end of the tunnel (pardon the old cliche).  I hope you get the result you want, I'm positive you will x Take care and all best wishes MO xx
Posts.Title: back pain and anastrozole

Posts.Content: I had a lumpectomy in July 2017 on 1 breast, but Is it just me,  does anyone else have problems wth getting the right words out of their mouth or though i know what i want to say.  i started on letrozole  17 months ago.  Once i got well into taking letrozole i thought , oh thats good, no problems, but things are gradually creepng up on me - back ache,  pain in hips,    niggles in my breast,  forgetting things, occasional shortage of breath. I dont understand why this is happening after all ths tme.
Posts.Title: memory and speech

Posts.Content: Hi Ginacaria,  I had a lumpectomy in July 2017 and started on Letrozole. For the 1st year, I had no trouble at all so I thought it was going to be great for 5 years..Wrong!  I started having joint pains everywhere.  Luckily all my joint pains didn't happen all at once, one day it was knees, next it was ankle and hip pains, etc. It was as though I was on a roundabout.  I eventually saw my oncologist and she changed my medication to Anastrozole hoping it would be better.  I have been on this for 6 weeks and so far, I have different problems.  I am having pains and tenderness in my ribs, on and off.  Shoulder pains going to right elbow, more back ache. I am due my 2nd mammogram in June with a follow up appointment with my oncologist, so I shall see if there is something else to try.  These things are sent to try us!  Keep smiling, there isn't  much else to do. MO xx
Posts.Title: back pain and anastrozole

Posts.Content: Yes NiceCuppa, it really is June and before you know it, it will be the other big 'C' but a nicer one with a  tree and you will be on a straight road ahead.   Hope everything goes well for you and the other ladies who have not started, or in the middle or the end of RT.  Take care and hugs to you all.
Posts.Title: **JUNE BREAST CANCER RADIOTHERAPY CHAT**

Posts.Content: Hi LexiT7  I had 15 sessions of RT in 2017 and all I can say is that the team treated me like a 1st class passenger on a train to recovery..Marvellous attention.  Thinking of all the ladies boarding that train. MO XX
Posts.Title: **JUNE BREAST CANCER RADIOTHERAPY CHAT**

Posts.Content: Hi Debs64 How are you now, I hope you are rid of your headaches.  I just got back from seeing my GP and  talking through most of the side effects, time allowing!  I stop taking Letrozole for 4 weeks, and assured me there is enough Letrozole in my system to keep me safe. Then I start on Anastrozole,  4 weeks later.   I hope this change of medication will lessen my  eye problems and also the occasional pain in  my temple and several side effects.  I wish you well and hope you are free of anymore headaches.   All the best
Posts.Title: Headaches with letrazole. GP sending me for a brain scan

Posts.Content: HiDebs64 I've been on Letrozole getting on for nearly 2 years. The first year I had no side effects at  all. Now well into the 2nd year, it's seems that every possible side effect is being thrown at me in turns!  Aching joints 1 week, fatigue another week, eye probs etc.  This week it the turn of a pain in my temple...It's  not continually there, once or twice a day for short time.  It goes away as quickly as it came.  My consultant is changing my medication to Anastrazole to see if I have the same side effects , so I'll try them. Fingers crossed.
Posts.Title: Headaches with letrazole. GP sending me for a brain scan

Posts.Content: Good morning debs64 Glad to see your headaches have eased.  My right eye is sticky in the morning and sometimes when I wake up, I have to prise the eye lid open.  I've  been using night eye drops from boots and they have been better when I wake, but during the day they water , some days they clear up others, they don't.  I have stopped using eye make up in case they make things worse.  I am off to see my GP tomorrow and taking a list of problems with me, a lot to discuss in 10 minutes Ha Ha.
Posts.Title: Headaches with letrazole. GP sending me for a brain scan
